inclusion.criterion: Be capable of giving informed consent.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient text does not mention any issues with informed consent.

inclusion.criterion: Have a pathology proven diagnosis of any of newly diagnosed Glioblastoma Multiforme
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has anaplastic astrocytoma, not glioblastoma multiforme.

inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: No mention of WHO classification in patient text.

inclusion.criterion: Have completed the first part of standard of care chemo-radiation (Stupp), for 6 weeks, and not started the maintenance phase of temozolomide
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient received radiation followed by temozolomide, but duration is unclear.

inclusion.criterion: Agree to use effective barrier contraception while on treatment and for 2 months thereafter, if of childbearing potential
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's reproductive status or plans in patient text.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma, but no clear indication of limited life expectancy.

inclusion.criterion: Be between the ages of 18 to 74
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient is 45 years old, within the specified age range.

inclusion.criterion: Have a performance status KPS 70 or greater
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's performance status in patient text.

inclusion.criterion: Be able to swallow pills and capsules
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient is described as having severe lower extremity weakness, but no indication of difficulty swallowing.

inclusion.criterion: Be able to tolerate oral chemotherapeutic medications, with no health threatening allergies or side effects, based on lab and clinical findings
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: Patient has chronic pain and hypertension, but no clear indication of intolerance to oral chemotherapy.

inclusion.criterion: Have adequate bone marrow function, liver function and renal function before commencing therapy
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's laboratory values in patient text.

exclusion.criterion: Prior chemotherapy with capecitabine or temozolomide for other prior malignancies.
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: Patient received temozolomide during radiation, but this is allowed per trial criteria.

exclusion.criterion: Patients previously treated with continuous infusion 5-FU or any schedule of DTIC, which are similar to capecitabine and temozolomide, respectively, will be excluded.
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's prior chemotherapy regimens in patient text.

exclusion.criterion: Prior chemotherapies for newly diagnosed GBM or AA, other than temozolomide during radiation.
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: Patient received temozolomide during radiation, which is allowed per trial criteria.

exclusion.criterion: Patients with a history of severe hypersensitivity reaction to capecitabine, 5-FU, temozolomide (i.e. anaphylaxis or anaphylactic reactions),
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's prior hypersensitivity reactions in patient text.

exclusion.criterion: Serious medical or psychiatric illness preventing informed consent or treatment (e.g., serious infection)
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Patient has chronic pain and hypertension, but no clear indication of a serious medical or psychiatric illness.

exclusion.criterion: Prior malignancies in the last 5 years other than curatively treated carcinoma in-situ previously treated with curative intent (cancer free for the past one year).
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's prior malignancies in patient text.

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: No mention of patient's performance status in patient text.

exclusion.criterion: Inability to swallow pills and capsules
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: Patient is described as having severe lower extremity weakness, but no indication of difficulty swallowing.

notes: Key unknowns include patient's WHO classification, performance status, and laboratory values. Additionally, the duration of standard of care chemo-radiation completed by the patient is unclear.
